revised_title: Investigation of Ultimate Pressures and Gas Absorption in Oil-Diffusion Pumps
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using two ionization gauges to measure the pressure in the same vessel and discovered that oil-diffusion pump vapors are absorbed in the gauges by two processes, transient and continuous. They calculated the ultimate pressure of the pump, the partial pressures of reaction products, and the errors of both gauges for the case of Apiezon oil. The lowest pressures achievable with oils alone are higher than previously believed.
